PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Afrikaans: Oranjerivier, German: Oranjefluss or just Oranje), in the past also sometimes known as the Gariep or as the Grootrivier, is the major river of South Africa.
was first discovered by indigenous people but only explored by Europeans in 1760 and named after the House of Orange, which was the Stadhouder of Holland between 1777-79. Another account of
may have been called after the supposedly orangy colour of
water, as opposed to the colour of the water of the Vaal River ( 'vaal' being Afrikaans for pale or grey).
